content:
• Wednesday, July 24, 2013
  • SINA

    Chinese Internet stocks finished AH trading with solid gains thanks to Baidu's big Q2 beat and...

    Chinese Internet stocks finished AH trading with solid gains thanks to Baidu's big Q2 beat and above-consensus Q3 guidance.  Baidu mentioned in its report revenue/ad customer rose 11% Q/Q, and that mobile now accounts for over 10% of its sales. SINA +4.1%. SOHU +2.2%. RENN +4.3%. YOKU +3.6%. YY +3.1%. Rival QIHU +3.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 PM
  • COG

    More on Cabot Oil & Gas' (NYSE:COG) Q2 results: Natural gas production jumped 53% while...

    More on Cabot Oil & Gas' (NYSE:COG) Q2 results: Natural gas production jumped 53% while realized average prices, including hedging effects, rose 20% Y/Y. Output of oil, condensate and natural gas liquids rose 29% as average prices fell 1.2%. Adds a sixth rig in the Marcellus shale. Announces a two-for-one stock split and said its dividend will double on a pre-split basis. COG +1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • TER

    Teradyne (NYSE:TER) guides for Q3 revenue of $425M-$465M and EPS of $0.39-$0.49, well below a...

    Teradyne (NYSE:TER) guides for Q3 revenue of $425M-$465M and EPS of $0.39-$0.49, well below a consensus of $522.8M and $0.60. Though chip test equipment orders rose 40% Q/Q in Q2, wireless/system test orders "declined in the quarter as customers adjusted their capacity to market demand." Shares -7.5% AH, CC at 10AM ET tomorrow (webcast). (PR) (Q2 results)

  • WDC

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) guides on its FQ4 call for FQ1 revenue of $3.7B-$3.8B and EPS of...

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) guides on its FQ4 call for FQ1 revenue of $3.7B-$3.8B and EPS of $1.95-$2.05, largely unfavorable to a consensus of $3.77B and $2.05. Shares now -5.9% AH. Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) -2.1% in sympathy. In its quarterly fact sheet, WDC states its total hard drive shipments fell 16% Y/Y in FQ4 to 59.9M, as 27% and 24% drops in notebook and desktop drive shipments (over 2/3 of total shipments) offset consumer electronics and branded drive growth, and roughly flat enterprise shipments. WDC and STX both fell in regular trading thanks to Seagate's numbers (I, II, III).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM
  • CAKE

    More on Cheesecake Factory's (NASDAQ:CAKE) Q2: Shares fall 4.53% AH as results fall short on...

    More on Cheesecake Factory's (NASDAQ:CAKE) Q2: Shares fall 4.53% AH as results fall short on both the top and bottom line. Comps increase 0.8% Y/Y (+0.9% at namesake stores and 0.1% at Grand Lux Cafe). The company announces a 17% increase in its quarterly dividend and says the board has increased its buyback authorization by 7.5M shares. (PR)

    More on Skechers' (NYSE:SKX) Q2: Shares rise 3% AH as EPS comfortably beats estimates. Gross...

    More on Skechers' (NYSE:SKX) Q2: Shares rise 3% AH as EPS comfortably beats estimates. Gross margin rises 90 bps Y/Y on "improvements in company-owned retail stores and international subsidiary businesses combined with the expected decrease in international distributor sales, which carry lower gross margins," CFO David Weinberg says. Domestic and international comps jump 16.5% despite unseasonably cool temperatures. (PR)

  • CMO

    More on Capstead Mortgage (NYSE:CMO) Q2 earnings: Book value per share of $12.80 off 5.9% from...

    More on Capstead Mortgage (NYSE:CMO) Q2 earnings: Book value per share of $12.80 off 5.9% from Q1 and vs. today's close of $11.42 puts the shares at a 10.8% discount (bit of a difference from HTS). Book value was negatively impacted by 2.1% ($0.28) due to the preferred capital raise during quarter. Management expects to recover this over the next 3 years thanks to better rate on new preferreds. Net interest spread of 1% off 15 bps from Q1. AUM about level from last quarter, with leverage perking up to 8.44:1. Shares +2.6% AH. CC tomorrow at 9 ET. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM | 3 Comments
  • VAR

    More on Varian Medical's (NYSE:VAR) FQ3: Shares slide 6.7% AH as revenue misses. The company...

    More on Varian Medical's (NYSE:VAR) FQ3: Shares slide 6.7% AH as revenue misses. The company blames the top line shortfall on "significant currency headwinds with the yen [and] inventory adjustments among major X-ray tube customers in Japan." Cash flow from operations hits a record $198M. Segment revenue growth: Oncology, +3%; X-Ray, +7%, Other, -8%. FY13 guidance: "The sharp decline in the yen as well as uncertain timing of revenues from a proton therapy project in Maryland" lead management to cut its outlook for EPS and revenue growth to $4-4.04 and 5% respectively from $4.09-4.14 and 8% previously. Consensus is $4.10/ share. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM

    Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX) resumes trading, -21.4% AH after posting Q2 results and issuing downward Q3...

    Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX) resumes trading, -21.4% AH after posting Q2 results and issuing downward Q3 guidance, seeing $0.20-$0.23 EPS vs. $0.39 consensus and $300M-$310M revenue vs. $325M consensus. Backlog at Q2's end was $161M, down 6.7% Y/Y, blamed on wholesale accounts taking a cautious view towards fall holiday 2013 orders based on weaker than expected spring 2013 sales.

  • ETFC

    More on E-Trade (NASDAQ:ETFC) Q2 earnings: Daily Average Revenue Trades (DARTS) of 150K...

    More on E-Trade (NASDAQ:ETFC) Q2 earnings: Daily Average Revenue Trades (DARTS) of 150K up 8% Y/Y. Net new brokerage accounts of 30K vs. 46K added a year ago. $220B in customer assets vs. $190B a year ago. Net interest spread of 2.35 up 5 bps from Q1. Core operating expenses of $262M off $21M from Q1 as the cost reduction program is substantially completed. Net charge-offs of $50M off $18M from Q1. Special-mention delinquencies off 14%, total at-risk delinquencies off 17%. Shares +4.6% AH. CC at 5 ET. (PR)

    More on Visa (NYSE:V) FQ3 earnings: Net operating revenue of $3B up 17% Y/Y. Payments volume...

    More on Visa (NYSE:V) FQ3 earnings: Net operating revenue of $3B up 17% Y/Y. Payments volume growth of 13% to $1.1T. Total processed transactions of 15B, up 14%. Service revenue of $1.3B up 7%. Data processing revenue of $1.2B up 15%. International transaction revenue of $854M up 14%. Operating expenses of $1.2B up 9%. 6M shares repurchased leaving $61M in remaining funds under existing program. New buyback authorization of $1.5B is announced.   • SQNM

    More on Sequenom's (NASDAQ:SQNM) Q2: CMM diagnostics services revenues come in at $24.5M. The...

    More on Sequenom's (NASDAQ:SQNM) Q2: CMM diagnostics services revenues come in at $24.5M. The company says it (as well as competitors) "experienced delays in receipt of payments as a result of molecular diagnostics coding changes adopted by CMS, Medicaid and third party payors." Total tests accessioned rise 130% to 46,700 patient samples (38K MaterniT21 PLUS samples). Overall gross margin climbs 200 bps Y/Y. CFO Paul Maier says he is "disappointed by the delay in the collection of diagnostic segment revenues during the second quarter," but notes that collections should improve in H2. Update 4:39: Shares slide 25% AH. (PR)

    USEC (USU +7%) extends the meteoric rise that has quadrupled the market value of the small...

    USEC (USU +7%) extends the meteoric rise that has quadrupled the market value of the small uranium company. Traders attribute the move to an ongoing short squeeze; given the market cap and volume, it doesn't take much to generate one as the fast money gets in. A few analysts also are taking notice, as the environment is ripe for sector acquisitions (NYSEARCA:URA) that could pay off when demand revives.

  • CEVA

    CEVA (CEVA -12.8%) is ending the day with huge losses after Broadcom, which uses CEVA's DSP...

    CEVA (CEVA -12.8%) is ending the day with huge losses after Broadcom, which uses CEVA's DSP cores in its baseband chips, missed Q2 estimates and issued light Q3 guidance, while blaming the shortfall in large part on light baseband sales. Chip stocks on the whole have had a bad day (SOXX -1.8%), as Broadcom's numbers and a ho-hum report from ARM overshadow Apple's FQ3 beat. SIMG -3.8%. OVTI -2.8%. MU -3.9%. SNDK -2.4%. IMOS -4.5%. Broadcom set-top chip rival STMicroelectronics (STM -2.7%) has fallen for the second day in a row following its Q2 report and soft Q3 guidance, aided by a downgrade to Underperform from BofA.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • WRK

    Shares of Rock-Tenn (RKT +7.2%) enjoy a strong session following the containerboard company's Q2...

    Shares of Rock-Tenn (RKT +7.2%) enjoy a strong session following the containerboard company's Q2 report which handily beat analysts' EPS expectations. Earnings more than doubled from Q2 2012 during the period and revenues rose 6.3% as corrugated and consumer packaging tons shipped increased 102K tons and 15K tons respectively. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • MON

    Monsanto (MON -2%) is offering Brazilian farmers a 16% discount on its newest genetically...

    Monsanto (MON -2%) is offering Brazilian farmers a 16% discount on its newest genetically modified soybeans if they drop claims that patents on older beans expired years ago. MON’s Intacta soy went on sale today in Brazil for 115 reais ($51.23) per hectare, but farmers who agree to release MON from patent claims will pay just 96.50 for the next four years.

It's a bad day for the miners (GDX -6.2%) too: ABX -6.3%, GFI -4.8%, GG -5.8%, NEM -5.6%, KGC -6.1%, NGD -3.4%, EGO -6.4%, AUY -6.6%, AEM -7.6%. Silver miners (SIL -5.4%): SLW -4.7%.

  • EA

    Electronic Arts (EA +8.2%) has soared to new 52-week highs following its big FQ1 beat and...

    Electronic Arts (EA +8.2%) has soared to new 52-week highs following its big FQ1 beat and in-line FY14 guidance; Activision (ATVI +1.1%) and Take-Two (TTWO +1%) are up moderately. EA managed to grow its Battlefield 3 Premium sub base by 500K Q/Q to 4M+, and mobile revenue rose 33% Y/Y to $104M (21% of total) thanks to in-app purchases for The Simpsons: Tapped Out and Real Racing 3. Home console ($191M) and PC ($175M) revenue both fell 6% Y/Y. While total revenue rose 1% Y/Y, opex fell 3% thanks to recent job cuts. Also: EA has announced it's partnering with Chinese gaming giant Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY) to bring FIFA Online 3 to China. Wedbush is pulling EA from its Best Ideas list, arguing a lot of good news is priced in, but maintaining an Outperform. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • BTU

    Coal stocks (KOL -2.8%) come back to earth a day after Peabody Energy (BTU -4.9%) led S&P...

    Coal stocks (KOL -2.8%) come back to earth a day after Peabody Energy (BTU -4.9%) led S&P energy gainers upon reporting a surprising Q2 profit. Walter Energy's (WLT -17%) dividend cut and liquidity issues aren't helping. Tudor Pickering downgrades BTU, Alpha Natural (ANR -7.4%) and Arch Coal (ACI -7.1%) to Accumulate from Buy after the run-up. Also: CNX -3.4%, YZC -4%, CLD -4.1%, JRCC -4.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 3 Comments
  • EXAS

    Exact Sciences (EXAS -1.6%) slumps after SA contributor Alpha Exposure publishes the first part...

    Exact Sciences (EXAS -1.6%) slumps after SA contributor Alpha Exposure publishes the first part of a 5-part bear case. The author takes aim at the effectiveness and pricing of EXAS' Cologuard cancer test product relative to rival products, and accuses the company of using outdated and misleading data to make Cologuard appear more effective than it actually is. Alpha Exposure: "We believe that as the true irrelevance of the Cologuard test comes to light, it has a high likelihood of being rejected by the FDA." Shares fell yesterday following a Q2 miss.
